Delighted to have #CCLeaders alum Jessica Sim back for Creative Climate Leadership at #COP24. We have to action with courage, creativity, and ambition - using all of our skills, ingenuity, and creativity every day to try and nudge us away from climate breakdown. Read @JBgreenmusic on how the creative community can respond to #climatechange: https://t.co/8KwsbJExKV

So what cities are already doing and what more can be done? Our Culture and Climate Change resource with @c40cities and @wccforum shares recommendations and best practice in embedding sustainability into cultural policy. Check it out: https://t.co/PsrSUHhH4z #WorldCitiesDay

Where does culture fit in? Culture is essential to creating sustainable cities that are resilient, future-proofed and livable. It's vital for regeneration and city identity. That's why it's crucial to create frameworks that weave sustainability into cities' cultural programming.

Today is #WorldCitiesDay! Cities are on the front line of climate change - they generate over 80% of global GDP & over 70% of global greenhouse gas emissions. But, this also means cities are uniquely positioned to tackle climate change.
Pictured: Marling by Usman Haque, Eindhoven https://t.co/LrFV9mcxJ3

And a timely read on #WorldCitiesDay too - what can historic buildings and heritage sites teach us about building sustainable and resilient cities, and how can we work with them to revitalise our cities? #ClimateHeritage @ClimateHeritage

"Looked after properly, our historic buildings have a resilience to our changing climate that may be lost on modern buildings." Great read from @HistEnvScot's @DMHarkin reflecting on the role of cultural heritage in global climate action. #ClimateHeritage https://t.co/Tv3dLvcBGq

#greendance dance orgs can start measuring carbon impacts on IG Tools: www.juliesbicycle.com/ig-tools
#greendance Reducing the impacts of our buildings is a priority compared to touring (tho touring is important of course)
#greendance getting carbon data from across the dance sector is doable and will allow us to plan intelligently for making reductions
#greendance Communication is key: by sharing successes in reducing impacts we can raise general awareness of issue but need to act first
#greendance Kenneth Tharp: the dance sector needs a green manifesto and a green guide for dance
#greendance Kenneth Tharp (The Place): need to find ways to engage artists in this conversation early on
#greendance Kenneth Tharp: communication of and focus on changing behaviours could make a big impact
#greendance creative sectors need to shape solutions that work for our business on our terms
#greendance Janet Archer: good to explore working digitally e.g. Cloud based IT systems for orgs can reduce emissions
#greendance Alison Tickell: new business models - what will sector look like if we are working less competitively?
#greendance Alison Tickell: concerns about imposing agenda on artists but response can focus on how we make work rather than content
#greendance Judith Knight: working collaboratively and less competitively will make a response to this issue faster & with mutual benefits
#greendance Judith Knight: Richard Maxwell has used holograms of performers - e.g. of creative ways to reduce touring emissions
#greendance Judith Knight: Plan Food Cafe tour - travelled by train & sourced set and performers locally
#greendance Judith Knight: why can't we keep shows on for longer? Can we make less?
#greendance Judith Knight: Toynbee Studios reduced waste to landfill by having only one waste bin in office
#greendance Judith Knight: must lose exclusivity of international shows - festivals/orgs need 2 share more work from international companies
#greendance Judith Knight: artists tending to enjoy more local work / spending more time in countries abroad to work with local communities
#greendance Judith Knight: 2009 Slow Boat conference explored idea that creativity doesn't have mean bigger & more expensive to be better
#greendance Judith Knight: Artsadmin joined up with EU wide Imagine 2020 network to present climate change-inspired work & green operations
#greendance Judith Knight: what are ethics of touring when benefits are felt by western audiences & climate effects in developing nations?
#greendance Judith Knight (Artadmin): arts have unique responsibility to climate change and communicating the issue to the public
#greendance Nadia Stern: important to establish benchmarks specifically for cultural spaces to help gauge progress
#greendance Nadia Stern: sMeasure tool tracks energy use over time via weekly meter readings - www.sMeasure.org.uk
#greendance Nadia Stern: new buildings mean more processes become electronic - interesting 2 see how modernity affects environmental impacts
#greendance Nadia Stern: we've worked with JB to create a benchmark to measure difference in impacts btw new and old building
#greendance Nadia Stern (Rambert): first dance company to have environmental funding conditions from ACE via a capital development grant
#greendance Janet Archer: by 2015 all NPOs will need to have environmental policy, action plan and measuring carbon impacts
#greendance Janet Archer: NPO orgs will be required 2 set a baseline of environmental impacts in 2012/13 using online environmental resource
#greendance - Janet Archer: ACE policy acknowledges that climate change is as much a cultural issue as scientific one & requires action
#greendance Janet Archer: Charlotte Spencer talks abt dance as meaning-making artform which has potential 2 change the way people think/feel
#greendance Janet Archer - small actions make a big difference - switching off equipment, using recycled paper, cycling are all quick wins
#greendance Janet Archer (ACE) important to involve everyone in an org about personal response to org's sustainability
#greendance Alistair Spalding - can we set up a regulatory body for environmental impacts of international and UK wide touring?
#greendance Alistair Spalding - Sadler's Well has reduced energy and increase recycling rates through empowering a committed green team
#greendance 3. Savings - orgs can save cash as well as carbon (JB orgs saved 7000 tonnes or carbon and ¬£1 million from 2009-11)
#greendance 2. Funding requirements (ACE now require NPOs to manage environmental impacts)
#greendance the business case for arts orgs to go green: 1. long term planning for resilience and secure business models (Sian Alexander)

Use reusable Velcro and recycled bike tyre inner tubing to replace PVC - it is environmentally terrible! #sustp
Stage lighting = 10% of theatre energy use so front of house/backstage lighting should use low energy options too #sustp
Designers want to be more plugged into decision making processes so that their opinions on sustainability can be heard #sustp
Top production tip 3: recycle and reuse set and prop materials #sustp
Top production tip 2: integrate sustainability into planning and management decisions #sustp
Top production tip: know your stuff about what materials an technologies are environmentally sustainable #sustp
Collective action is key to JB's work - it eliminates competitive concerns & encourages shared learning (Sian A, JB) #sustp
Sustainability should be as engrained as health & safety - let's not wait for legislation but set the terms ourselves (Paul Handley) #sustp
Need sustainability doc for venues to outline their terms to freelancers and artists who work there (Paule Constable) #sustp
More discussions between theatres are happening 2 look for solutions. Collaboration is key 2 addressing sustainability (Paul Handley) #sustp
Climate change is a global problem or it's nothing; this jars with UK stance of acting in 'national interest' - there's no such thing #sustp
Water backstage - provide reusable drinking bottles, dispensers and encourage tap water drinking - get rid of plastic bottles (Paule) #sustp
Lighting designers need to start switching off rigs during the day & switching back on before the show (Paule Constable) #sustp
Institutions need to support conversations around sustainability with artists & freelancers and keep issue alive (Paule Constable) #sustp
interest in reuse, vintage & period clothes/furniture means sustainable values naturally been part of my aesthetic (Soutra Gilmour) #sustp
Interested in new technologies/materials being developed in other industries to find the benefit for theatre design (Soutra Gilmour) #sustp
Designers' work when freelance is often determined by people in the venues we work in (Soutra Gilmour) #sustp

The real problem = there is no incentive for change, we need to get beyond 'if u won't change I won't change' mentality (David Frame) #sustp
If art neglects the values & issues of sustainability in performance & production it's integrity may suffer in future (David Frame) #sustp
People find it easier to discuss their shared experience and ownership of the future rather than the present (David Frame) #sustp
By 2nd half of this century the cost of climate change will out-weight the cost of cutting emissions now (David Frame) #sustp
Art can move past the moralistic tone of environmentalism; a piece about climate change provides a forum for discussion (David Frame) #sustp
Plays can portray complexity and explore a space without passing judgement - can access new audiences for this debate (David Frame) #sustp

This guide by @JuliesBicycle will w‚Ä¶

‚ÄúThe arts and culture sector is working hard to survive, but it is also an integral part of ensuring that we all thrive. If we are truly to ‚Äòbuild back better‚Äô then support for our creative industries is vital.‚Äù @triodosuk sharing their support https://t.co/wwKEFBsr2a

And finally, what is @charisejeanine_‚Äôs #climatesuperpower?! ‚ÄòWeaving and making connections between disparate issues and getting folks who wouldn‚Äôt normally get involved in environmental action to find a way in!‚Äô We love it! Keep it up, thank you Charise :) #CreativeClimateChat

‚ÄòWhile it‚Äôs a sprint for some people, it‚Äôs a marathon for others, and building relationships takes time.‚Äô @charisejeanine_ explaining that, yes, we need to take urgent action but we also need to do so whilst being sensitive to the voices that oft get ignored #CreativeClimateChat

‚ÄòEvery organisation can do more to make sure they‚Äôre looking at the words they‚Äôre using and things they say, and asking: who does that serve?‚Äô @charisejeanine_ on checking our environmental exclusivity #CreativeClimateChat

‚ÄòPolicy makers just want to know the point: what is it you want me to do? And art can get to that point... and get to the emotion that we really need‚Äô @charisejeanine_ on what science and policy can learn from the arts #CreativeClimateChat

‚ÄòWe learn these words but don‚Äôt pay attention to the history of them... they‚Äôre often loaded with so much exclusion and expression‚Äô @charisejeanine_ on why she rejected the term ‚Äòenvironmentalist‚Äô for so long #CreativeClimateChat

‚ÄúThe way people spoke about the environment didn‚Äôt include people like me‚Äù @charisejeanine_ tells us about how she found her way to this issue via the injustices of the BP oil spill 10 years ago #CreativeClimateChat

That's a wrap on our event Sustainable Production in The Arts. 

Thank you to our amazing speakers Paddy @TheatresTrust, Feimatta @MIFestival and Nathan @walktheplank! 

And thank you to everyone who joined and asked such interesting questions.
How do you engage audiences in conversations surrounding climate justice and sustainable production?
"I think it goes back to something, you know really fundamental which is thinking differently from the outset, and more time in the conception" - Paddy Dillon
A question for our speakers - How do you balance touring with its energy used for transport and carbon neutrality, big touring companies use their own lighting and sets. How do we balance that?
Our speakers have been asked about offsetting - check out our briefing here: https://t.co/GwXkyToxlA

"Production managers are great agents of change... we should be thinking about sustainability like health and safety, sustainability sits right alongside that...as far as getting production managers aligned in how we do things." - Nathan @walktheplank
RT @AditiJehangir: Really interesting #CreativeGreen webinar from @JuliesBicycle hearing from different ways sustainability can inform crea‚Ä¶

"I think it's really important to think about what happens to materials after the show is finished...what value do they still retain? Where can they fit into a circular economy model?" - Feimatta @MIFestival
"Theatre is a creative art form and creative artists will find ways to make brilliant and visually rich and beautiful shows sustainably." - Paddy @TheatresTrust
Nathan Jackson tell us about @walktheplank "We've created a culture where sustainability is now part of the agenda...The things that seemed hard five years ago now seemed easier."
Feimatta Conteh @MIFestival reminds us "Don't wait for everything to be in place before you start doing something."

We're live! Paddy Dillon @TheatresTrust "You have to see this as systems change...setting up a system taking that intricate connection of all the people who make up a production and working out what each one of them needs to do differently to allow change to happen."

On the role of the arts, Araceli talks about ways of exploring dance and music as healing - which can help people connect psychologically to the breath as sacred, whilst connecting up the breath to the health of our planet #CreativeClimateChat #SeasonforChange

We all have to trust each other and work in symbiosis - sharing tools, listening and trusting. We can't afford to erase anybody. We have to be careful of erasure and make sure we understand and respect the history of justice 

@aracelicamargo_ #CreativeClimateChat

Aracelia urges us to remember that it took 12 years for Rosamund Kissi-Debrah to get the acknowledgement about her daughter Ella's cause of death being #airpollution - that procrastination is part of the oppression 

https://t.co/yh0eBYXkyC

'Justice needs its own language' Araceli argues that Nature is alive and shouldn't be called 'it'. 

Environmental justice is about honouring community sovereignty, working with nature and with each other.

Share your questions for Araceli using the hashtag #CreativeClimateChat

We are hearing how the body returns to homeostasis and readjusts after stress responses, though repeated psychosocial + environmental stressors mean it's difficult for our bodies to heal. Araceli focuses on ecosystemic effects and health injustices in the oppression of our planet

@salomewagaine and @farzja introducing @aracelicamargo_, who offers an opening prayer for the people of Palestine. 

We're reminded that the breath is sacred, healing and political - we breathe in oxygen that goes through every single organ and ecosystem of cells in our body

RT @LucyHSierra: @JuliesBicycle @youngvictheatre Great to discuss sustainable design today. We're asking all the right questions &soon will‚Ä¶
"Designers need to encourage the industry to make better choices." DW
"There are things we can do as designers but also the systems have to change. By asking lots of questions we can get things to change." -SC
"There are some Production Managers that have a bit of creative license to navigate fireproofing regs but often things are more complex." TB
"We used sand based coating for fireproofing as its the best ecological solution. I'd like to see a change in regulation on this front" DW
Question about regulation. How do these kind of repurposed materials get through fire regulations?
@fanshentheatre Hope the live tweets are giving you an insight. We are also filming the event so you can check it out that way too. -JB
"We decided to print on the crates where the materials had travelled from. They had footprints before they even toured." Sam Collins
"We also looked at whether or not we should use different materials in what we create the standard shipping crates out of." Sam Collins
"Although artists are often very engaged with climate change they are only prepared to compromise their vision to a degree." Sam Collins
"How can we make a more sustainable kind of touring exhibition?" Sam Collins
"How do we justify artworks that talk about Carbon footprints when we are shipping huge works of art across the world." Sam Collins
"People say they cant afford to do things sustainably. I said they cant afford not to. Sometimes it is more costly - I offset" Donyale Werle
"I use cardboard that I find on the street. I rarely buy materials. I use Sushi boxes for the plastic in my models." Donyale Werle
"I dont get hired as a 'sustainable set designer.' I am a set designer." Donyale Werle
On Broadway I noticed there was a giant disconnect between my home and personal practice and what was going on in theatres - Donyale Werle
"If its black or if its white probably isnt the best choice. My colour palette has now changed. I work with grey or brown." Donyale Werle
"Theatre has been brought up in the linear, mechanistic, egological rather the ecological world view." Tanja Beer
"One day we wont need to use the word ecological - it will just be good design" Tanja Beer
"I set myself a challenge - to create a design that not only enriches an audience but also our environment and community." Tanja Beer
Physical production elements are only about 5% of the outputs of a building @MayorofLondon report

"Everyone on the staff is excepted to do something. In our annual appraisals we have green actions included." Nicola Walker @WhitworthArt
"You can make staff literate by doing and involving as many people as possible in the doing. Action and learning." Alison Tickell.
"How can we get colleagues to understand that sustainability is about more than just recycling? How do we get them excited?" #greenarts Q&A
"When it comes to conservation - damage from poor handling & light damage are much bigger issues than heat & humidity." Nicola Walker
"Change can also be very threatening. How can we get people inspired and excited about embracing change?" Q&A
"All values are human based and contingent on our culture. Values shapes the way we think and feel." John Holden #greenarts
"Politics struggles with both culture and the environment because their value can be hard to measure in conventional ways." John Holden
"A building like the Whitworth takes a set of values and then presents this value back to the public in a physical form." John Holden
"Increasing biodiversity - honey, fruit trees, herbs for use in the cafe and insect friendly plant life in the gardens." @WhitworthArt
"Natural daylight, louvres, blinds, LEDs all help contribute to more sustainable lighting in the gallery space" Nicola Walker @WhitworthArt
Hearing about whole host of sustainability initiatives from Nicola Walker @WhitworthArt including heating and lighting controls #greenarts
"One of the main challenges of urban sustainability is about making us more aware of where things like water & energy come from" James Evans
"We need change. What is that better alternative? We need to create something worth moving towards." James Evans #greenarts
"When we talk about environmental values, they are always built on social values - a social cause and a social impact." James Evans
We know the problem & we have most of the solutions. They have been honed & proven. Why aren't they happening systematically?" James Evans
@JuliesBicycle "We need to make room for these conversations in the civic, digital, investment, political space." #greenarts

Thanks to everyone who joined us for our #resilientmuseum live chat - check the hashtag for links and resources shared by our speakers!
Kevin from @CollectionTrust mentioned the @MuseumsAssoc #codeofethics re collection strategies: https://t.co/vuIe4P21zo #resilientmuseum

RT @Becky_Swain: How might we find even more ways to collect/share local voices/ narratives about how we can be more a #resilientmuseum and‚Ä¶
Final comment @CollectionTrust "Museums work together more - any suggestions about how to make this work better" #resilientmuseum
.@TWAMmuseums "A number of our venues are also part of Google Cultural Institute, so visitors can explore our venues from there sofas."
.@hilaryjennings "Materialism degrades matter, can museums rise it up? https://t.co/84XM6ohbez" #resilientmuseum
.@TWAMmuseums "Objects are based on how you interact with the site. The faster you scroll, the more random the results." #resilientmuseum
.@TWAMmuseums "Check out the digital collection platform https://t.co/OZYrdizrhc" #resilientmuseum
.@JuliesBicycle "How can the community be involved in creating the mission and relevance for museums?" #resilientmuseum
.@hilaryjennings 2/which will help us - the solutions may come from small unexpexted places #resilientmuseum
.@TWAMmuseums "We certainly do what Kevin has been discussing in terms of collecting. Must be relevant to our venues and our communities"
"There are whole systems behind collections which need careful consideration" #resilientmuseum issues around digital preservation
.@CollectionTrust "greatest threat to museums is irrelevance" #resilientmuseum
#resilientmuseum @hilaryjennings 1/Gr8 quote from kevin anderson, climate scientist-he says:we're a complex society & it's that complexity
#resilientmuseum how important is a connection between a museum's mission and it's capacity for resilience?
.@CollectionTrust New code of ethics from @MuseumsAssoc redefines definition of a museum #resilientmuseum PUBLIC FACING, PUBLIC COLLECTIONS
.@CollectionTrust "Unless a museum has a continuing & ongoing relationship with it's constituency it may not be viable #resilientmuseum"
.@CollectionTrust "A sustainable museum or any org is one that enough people value #resilientmuseum - serves a purpose"
.@TWAMmuseums Our mission is: to help people determine their place in the world & define their identities, so enhancing their self-respect
.@JuliesBicycle "There's specific networks for this i.e https://t.co/irBOyICeiN @nadineloach get involed! over 50 members" #resilientmuseum
.@JuliesBicycle "Cultural change needs to happen alongside technical training on #resilientmuseum good practice - make time for events"
.@CollectionTrust "Can use acclimatising cases for specific loans rather than whole air con system - don't impose criteria #resilientmuseum
.@CollectionTrust "National museums are being primed to become 'loan ready' to be able to receive loans - assoc. of Registrars have a role"
.@CollectionTrust "Useful resources and frameworks PAS198 and https://t.co/785TA664Wn #resilientmuseum " Live Chat @amadigital
.@TWAMmuseums "Computers to be turned off completely at the end of the day #resilientmuseum"
.@TWAMmuseums "also doing an awareness campaign with our staff about lighting and energy consumption, specifically electricity and heating."
.@TWAMmuseums "We've done a review of air conditioning, and aligning timings with essential requirements only" #resilientmusuem
@hilaryjennings Thanks Hilary - we hope to have you back soon : )
.@TWAMmuseums "Our stores at Discovery Museum & in Tyne & Wear Archives have a lighting system only comes on when someone's in that area."
.@CollectionTrust "Doing away with air conditioning means better air quality - used room within a room set up. Achieved BREAM excellence"
.@CollectionTrust "Sizewell nuclear station energy output was not reliable. Building new store w/ a passive approach works"#resilientmuseum
.@hilaryjennings "Another interesting project on #resilientmuseum is Where's Reading Heading? https://t.co/H0Ij3MNtGq "
.@hilaryjennings "E.g. is Community Conversations, Slough. Collection subject of broad discussions on food, customs, play" #resilientmuseum
.@TWAMmuseums "Our conservation team carry out regular tests in all our venues to ensure temps are at a correct level" #resilientmuseum
.@CollectionTrust "We are stewards of culture now but also for the future - national crisis in the amount of collecting" #resilientmuseum
.@CollectionTrust What are we going to be prioritising and collecting in future? #resilientmuseum in hands of specialist curators
.@TWAMmuseums Involved in Make Carbon History project committed to action now - both v.collaborative & involving visitors #resilientmuseum
.@hilaryjennings "There are immediate challenges to #resilientmuseum issues, we can't take our eye off the future maintain long term vision"
.@hilaryjennings "We've been thinking about 3 different contexts re: a #resilientmuseum future reality will be different - jump forward"
.@TWAMmuseums have 9 venues across Tyne&Wear & also look after the NE Museum Development group who won a Green Apple Award #resilientmuseum
.@CollectionTrust Kevin "A #resilientmuseum is one that can withstand the shocks" see news in current issue of Museums Journal @saskmuseums
.@hilaryjennings works @HappyMuseum on museums in community contexts and on wellbeing initiatives within museum sites #resilientmuseum

Thanks to everyone for joining us for the chat and to @GoodEnergy @DianaLiv @JB_Alison and to @HowFascinating #COP21response
.@JB_Alison And really energy is a big issue - how do we switch to clean energy to power a better sector #COP21response
.@DianaLiv Issues with management of livestock need to be addressed. This is a huge issue #COP21response
.@JB_Alison It's critical to widen up the discussion now about impact on the natural world #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy We could do a lot more to act on preventing deforestation. This is a massive issue for some very big countries #COP21response
#COP21response What 1 thing can orgs do in the short term to make an impact? If you're too prescriptive this alienates people #COP21response
.@JB_Alison We are clear that we want to encourage as many organisations as poss to source clean energy & communicate this #COP21response
.@JB_Alison In the UK we are not getting a lot of support from the govt. to take action and make changes #COP21response
.@DianaLiv What strategies are countries going to use for implementation? How ethical are the responses? Take GMO for example #COP21response
.@DianaLiv Kyoto didn't fail it met a lot of the actions discussed such as in renewables #COP21response
.@DianaLiv What we saw in Paris is the countries who are going to implement actions see these as economic decisions #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy Any environmentaltreaty only as good as the global citizens that sign it, different levels of confidence of each #COP21response
.@DianaLiv 'Our responsibility is to work with govt. talk to the people who get it - ask what we can do to help not tell' #COP21response
#COP21response - the question of trust: How can we trust an agreement from a country that does not support it? Thoughts on trust
.@HowFascinating 'great e.g.s of arts orgs working with city officials and city depts. check out the work of @mastgreenarts' #COP21response
.@JB_Alison Climate change & the environment are too much a part of city planners work & lack an essential creative element #COP21response
.@JB_Alison we really need to start engaging with cities as the portals into the mass population - see the work of @c40cities #COP21response
.@DianaLiv 2/ are seeing cultural partnerships as part of this. They're the ones rolling out the cuts to carbon emissions etc #COP21response
.@DianaLiv 1/ Cities were some of the major actors at #COP21 not sure how many of these major city admins #COP21response
.@JB_Alison 2/ hard policy frameworks needed and this new movement needs to start this #COP21response
.@JB_Alison 1/ There is v.little infrastructure for forcing hard commitments in the cultural sector #COP21response
.@JB_Alison There's a need to force these issues, we thank @ace_national for taking courage to force these issues with us #COP21response
.@DianaLiv Yes a diverse array of actions but lets have a mechanism to measure the effectiveness of these responses #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy Getting the messages out there reminds us that what we do makes a difference #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy The cultural sector forms a lighter, more fun part of our lives so covering these issues gives a new perspective #COP21response
.@JB_Alison If we take this extraordinary collection of disciplines in the whole creative sector we can communicate better #COP21response
.@DianaLiv the job now is to move from establishing concern to imagining a more positive future #COP21response
.@DianaLiv the cultural sector did a good job in each of the countries of building the concern #COP21response
.@JB_Alison 2/ the creative industries can keep the issue alive #COP21response
.@JB_Alison 1/ The cultural sector inhabits a particular place in the hearts and minds of people - #COP21response
.@JB_Alison the case for action on climate needs to be made in creative ways #COP21response
.@DianaLiv We need to keep focused on this issue and avoid an up and down media coverage of the issues #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy When we get messages out thru the arts we make a big noise, it's more successful see Code Red film Man vs Earth #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy #COP21 had a huge success with raising public awareness #COP21response
Our responses can be very practical - Q for @GoodEnergy what can we advise the sector to do #COP21response
#COP21response the key word for me is 'ambition' now with the task ahead @JB_Alison
.@JB_Alison'How does this agreement relate as a cultural issue?An interesting range of disciplines are coming together to act #COP21response
.@JB_Alison I've coined a new term for talking about my #COP21response 'COPTIVISM' #COP21response
Question for the panel: 'Will this agreement inspire more?' #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy 'It's a landscape of encouragement but I am cautious about seeing any additional change' #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy 'The concept of let's agree to act on things 'as soon as possible' is problematic language' #COP21response
.@GoodEnergy Mark Meyrick says 'in some ways we're putting off for tomorrow what needs to be done today #COP21' #COP21response
.@DianaLiv 'the govt are likely to take credit for the actions that are happening out there already #COP21' #COP21response
.@DianaLiv 'my glass half empty interpretation - the commitments are only half of what needs to happen from #COP21' #COP21response
.@DianaLiv 'for many of us the outcome promising - countries like India and China making commitments that hadn't previously' #COP21response
.@JB_Alison 'the role of non state actors came to the fore, to work together during #COP21 to create a context for action' #COP21response
Ok we've got @DianaLiv @GoodEnergy & @JB_Alison here chatting about #COP21 sharing their immediate thoughts on the agreement #COP21response
